input:
You are a video scriptwriter. Craft a short, suspenseful story for a video script, targeting an audience aged 16 to 45.
    The story should be a modern tech thriller about a young coder who uncovers a global conspiracy hidden in an old app's code.
    The script must be engaging and immersive, with a sense of urgency and mystery.
    The script should have exactly 12 scenes.
    Character of the story: 'David', 'Lucy', 'Narrator'

output.description: A modern tech thriller about a young coder who uncovers a global conspiracy hidden in an old app's code, forcing him to question everything and fight for his life as powerful forces close in.

scenes.speak: Why did this old weather app still exist? No one used it anymore.
scenes.image: David sits at his desk, staring at an outdated weather app on his screen. Rain patters against the window outside.

scenes.speak: But David’s curiosity was about to lead him down a path no one ever expected.
scenes.image: The camera zooms in as David clicks on the app, revealing hidden lines of code. A faint glow emanates from his screen.

scenes.speak: This can’t be right. This code doesn’t make sense. It’s not even for a weather app.
scenes.image: David leans closer, eyes widening as he scrolls through the lines of code. The glow pulses faintly.

scenes.speak: Something was buried deep inside. Something that didn’t belong there.
scenes.image: A close-up of David’s screen shows a encrypted message hidden in the code. The rain outside grows louder.

scenes.speak: I need to tell someone. Lucy would know what to do.
scenes.image: David grabs his phone, fingers shaking as he dials Lucy’s number. His reflection in the screen looks tense.
A flashback of David and Lucy working together in a bright office. The scene shifts to present-day Lucy, looking concerned over video call.

scenes.speak: I found something… in the old weather app. It’s not just an app. It’s a backdoor into something bigger.
scenes.image: David leans in close to his screen, whispering as if afraid someone is listening.

scenes.speak: But they were being watched. And the watchers weren’t friendly.
scenes.image: The camera pans out, revealing a shadowy figure outside David’s window. The glow from his screen flickers.

scenes.speak: They know I found it. They’re coming for me. I need to leave now!
scenes.image: David grabs his laptop, shoving files into a bag as the sound of footsteps echoes in the hallway outside.

scenes.speak: The hunt was on. And David was the only one who could stop what was coming next.
scenes.image: A montage of David running through dark streets, his breath visible in the cold air as he glances back over his shoulder.

scenes.speak: David! They’re tracking you. I’ve got a safe place, but you have to move fast!
scenes.image: A quick cut to Lucy at her computer, typing frantically as the sound of sirens wails in the distance.

scenes.speak: I’m almost there. Just… stay with me.
scenes.image: David reaches a dimly lit alleyway, his hands trembling as he types a final message to Lucy on his phone.

scenes.speak: The truth was out there. But so were they. And the game had just begun.
scenes.image: A shadowy figure steps forward from the darkness, their face obscured as David turns to see them. The screen fades to black.
